stimulusHtml: A small sphere of mass m0 is attached to a string of length l to form a simple pendulum that moves with a frequency f0 when it is displaced by a small angle and released from rest. The sphere is removed and replaced with a sphere with mass 2m0 and the length of the string is reduced to l2. Is the frequency of the pendulum the same in both situations? Why or why not?
choicesHtml: Yes, because the effect of increasing the mass of the sphere counteracts the effect of decreasing the string length.
Yes, because the frequency of the pendulum is independent of the mass of the sphere and the length of string.
No, because the greater sphere mass will cause the pendulum to have a smaller frequency.
No, because the shorter string will cause the pendulum to have a greater frequency.
